intro: Dunalia lycioides, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a fleshy berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds. Dunalia lycioides is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
